intro: Matelea tristis, commonly known as the Mexican moonflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant produces large, white, fragrant flowers that open at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a smooth texture and a slightly hairy underside. Matelea tristis is often found in rocky soils and can thrive in full sun to partial shade.
